decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: Rev A dated 7/2/2024 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan drawing no.A103, Proposed First Floor Plan drawing no.A104,  Proposed Front Elevation Plan drawing no.A105.1, Proposed Rear Elevation Plan drawing no.A105.2, Proposed Side Elevation (North) Plan drawing no.A106, Proposed Section 1 drawing no.A107, Proposed Sections 2 & 3 drawing no.A108, Proposed 3D1 and 3D2 drawing no.A109, Proposed 3D3 drawing no.A110, Proposed Section 4 drawing no.A112 and Proposed 3D (Front and Rear) Shadowing drawing no.A113
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).

| Cycling spaces (2 spaces) shall be provided and retained thereafter. The cycle parking spaces shall be secure and covered and shall be retained as such in perpetuity (as agreed by email received 24/1/2024)

Reason: To promote more sustainable forms of transportation, in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing's Sustainable Transport SPG 2019 and Ealing's Climate and Ecological Emergency Strategy
description: Part single, part two storey side/rear extension, conversion of garage into habitable room insertion of window in lieu of garage door opening and installation of a rooflight to front roofslope
